org.freezedry.persistence.readers

Class XmlReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.freezedry.persistence.readers.XmlReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PersistenceReader

    public class XmlReader
extends java.lang.Object
implements PersistenceReader
    Reads the specified XML input stream into an InfoNode tree. The InfoNode tree is populated with content and type information specified in the XML, but no more. Use the PersistenceEngine to convert the InfoNode to an object.

      • setRemoveEmptyTextNodes

        public void setRemoveEmptyTextNodes(boolean isRemove)
        Set to true to remove whitespace characters that are used for formatting; false to leave them
        Parameters:
        isRemove - Set to true to remove whitespace characters that are used for formatting; false to leave them

      • getRemoveEmptyTextNodes

        public boolean getRemoveEmptyTextNodes()
        Returns:
        true if the reader removes whitespace characters used to format the XML; false otherwise

      • read

        public InfoNode read(java.lang.Class<?> clazz,
            java.io.Reader input)
        Description copied from interface: PersistenceReader
        Reads the input stream into a semantic model represented by the return root InfoNode.
        Specified by:
        read in interface PersistenceReader
        Parameters:
        clazz - The Class to use as a template for creating the semantic model. This is effectively the "target" class.
        input - The input stream from which to read the persisted object.
        Returns:
        The root InfoNode representing the semantic model.

      • buildInfoNode

        public static InfoNode buildInfoNode(java.lang.Class<?> rootClass,
                     org.w3c.dom.Document document)
        Recursively build the InfoNode tree representation of the DOM tree
        Parameters:
        rootClass - The root Class represented by the XML file
        document - The root node of the DOM
        Returns:
        The InfoNode tree representing the DOM
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
